Enabled.Name: Hover Enabled
Enabled.Hint: Show the token note on hover.

SETTINGS.ShowJournalPreviewH: Shows a Journal preview when hovering over a map pin
SETTINGS.PreviewTypeH: The type of Journal preview to show (HTML or Text snippet)
SETTINGS.PreviewDelayH: How long before token note appears (in milliseconds)
SETTINGS.PlayerIconAutoOverrideH: Newly created notes will have player-only icons enabled automatically.
SETTINGS.revealedNotesN: Enable revealed state on scene Notes.
SETTINGS.revealedNotesH: When enabled, then the 'revealed' state will be used to determine if the Note is visible to players. (The default Foundry VTT behavior is for Notes to be visible to players only if the linked document is accessible by the player.)
SETTINGS.revealedNotesTintColorN: [Only if setting 'Enable revealed state on scene Notes.' is enabled] Set the tint color of the Note revealed state on scene Notes.
SETTINGS.revealedNotesTintColorH: Is an option to set the tint color of the Note icon to indicate if the linked document is reachable or not (if the Note has no linked document, then it will always be displayed in the 'unreachable' tint).
SETTINGS.revealedNotesTintColorLinkN: [Only if setting 'Enable revealed state on scene Notes.' is enabled] Linked Icon Tint
SETTINGS.revealedNotesTintColorLinkH: For PLAYERs, the RGB value to be used to tint scene Notes if they have a reachable link (if left blank then the tint, if any, will remain unchanged).  For GMs, this is the initial Icon Tint set during import
SETTINGS.revealedNotesTintColorNotLinkN: [Only if setting 'Enable revealed state on scene Notes.' is enabled] Not-linked Icon Tint
SETTINGS.revealedNotesTintColorNotLinkH: For PLAYERs, the RGB value to be used to tint scene Notes if they do not have a reachable link (if left blank then the tint, if any, will remain unchanged).  For GMs, this is the initial Icon Tint set during import
SETTINGS.revealedNotesTintColorRevealedN: [Only if setting 'Enable revealed state on scene Notes.' is enabled] Revealed Icon Tint
SETTINGS.revealedNotesTintColorRevealedH: For GMs, the RGB value to be used to tint scene Notes if they have been revealed to players (if left blank then the tint, if any, will remain unchanged).  For GMs, this is the initial Icon Tint set during import
SETTINGS.revealedNotesTintColorNotRevealedN: [Only if setting 'Enable revealed state on scene Notes.' is enabled] Not-revealed Icon Tint
SETTINGS.revealedNotesTintColorNotRevealedH: For GMs, the RGB value to be used to tint scene Notes if they have not been revealed to players (if left blank then the tint, if any, will remain unchanged)
SETTINGS.enableJournalThumbnailForGMsN: Enable Sidebar Journal Images for GM Users
SETTINGS.enableJournalThumbnailForPlayersN: Enable Sidebar Journal Images for Player Users
SETTINGS.journalThumbnailPositionN: [Only if setting 'Enable Sidebar Journal Images for GM Users' or 'Enable Sidebar Journal Images for Player Users' is enabled] Thumbnail Position
SETTINGS.journalThumbnailPositionH: Whether the thumbnail is left of the journal entry title or right
SETTINGS.fontSizeH: Override the base text size for the journal entry display. Example: 1.5rem.
SETTINGS.maxWidthH: The maximum width the entry display can grow to before it'll force wrapping.
SETTINGS.tooltipUseMousePositionForCoordinatesN: Use mouse position for show the tooltip
SETTINGS.tooltipUseMousePositionForCoordinatesH: When you hover a note on the canvas the tooltip is build based on the current mouse position instead the journal icon position. This solution seem to be more dynamic.
SETTINGS.forceToShowNotesH: Automatically flag journal notes to show on the map without having to have your players turn it on themselves.
SETTINGS.reset.name: Reset settings to default
SETTINGS.reset.label: Reset Settings To Default
SETTINGS.reset.hint: This will reset all of the settings of back to the active game system's default.
SETTINGS.debug.label: Prints debug messages to the console
SETTINGS.dialogs.resetcontent: Are you sure you want to reset all of the module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
SETTINGS.enableJournalAnchorLinkH: If you have the module 'Journal Anchor Links' activate and enabled you don't need this and the feature is automatically disabled for avoid conflict. This is a embedded integration of the module 'Journal Anchor Links'. Since Foundry VTT V10, journal entry anchor links are finally supported in the core software. However, weirdly enough it doesn't support anchor links in scene notes. This module fixes that. This feature provides Journals with much awaited page anchors, similar to how HTML supports it.
SETTINGS.allowNoteH: Allow Notes to trigger Tiles. Note sadly this will work only on standard foundry installation with standard path, so forge installation will not work.
SETTINGS.allowNotePassthroughN: [Only if setting 'Note Triggers ' is enabled] Allow Note Click-through
SETTINGS.allowNotePassthroughH: Allow Tiles underneath a note to still be triggered if the note is clicked on
SETTINGS.preventWhenPausedN: [Only if setting 'Note Triggers ' is enabled] Prevent when paused
SETTINGS.preventWhenPausedH: Prevent players from triggering Tiles when the game is paused.
SETTINGS.enableAutoScaleNamePlatesNoteN: Enable autoscale for nameplates of the note on the canvas
SETTINGS.enableAutoScaleNamePlatesNoteH: Enable autoscale for nameplates of the note on the canvas
SETTINGS.enableJournalDirectoryPagesN: Shows Pages in the journal directory
SETTINGS.enableJournalDirectoryPagesH: Adds expandable elements to the journals in their directory to show the journal's pages
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.enableN: Player Pin Defaults: Shows Pages in the journal directory
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.enableH: Adds expandable elements to the journals in their directory to show the journal's pages
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.globalN: Player Pin Defaults: Player Notes Globally Visible
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.globalH: When on, Globally Visited option is automatically applied, so all players can see this player's notes.
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.pinImageN: Player Pin Defaults: Default Pin Image
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.pinImageH: Link to an image that will be used as default icon for any player-made pins.
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.playerColorImageN: Player Pin Defaults: Player Color as Default Pin Image Color
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.playerColorImageH: When on, the player's color is used to tint the default image above, not used for the token option below.
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.playerTokenN: Player Pin Defaults: Player Token as Pin Image
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.playerTokenH: Sets the default pin token to the player's own token
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.anchorPointN: Player Pin Defaults: Text Anchor Point
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.addPlayerNameN: Player Pin Defaults: Player Name added to Text
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.addPlayerNameH: When on, the format of the pin label is "<pinlabel> /n <name of character>" on two lines.
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.playerColorTextN: Player Pin Defaults: Player Color as Text Color
SETTINGS.playerPinDefaults.playerColorTextH: When on, the player's color is used to tint the text color
SETTINGS.Tooltip.Color.title: Tooltip Color

token-note-hover.NumberWsSuffixOnNameplateN: Trick Setting: Enter the number of white spaces to be added as suffix (or prefix with negative number) in the nameplate of the note for a better center alignment
token-note-hover.NumberWsSuffixOnNameplateH: Temporary tooltip text alignment trick with width ratio != 1. Basically I would have to rewrite quite a bit of code, to apply the same logic as the tiles on the notes...something the foundryvtt team should do . As a temporary trick we add a number of whitespace as a suffix to better 'center' the text on the note.
token-note-hover.Tooltip.Placement.title: Tooltip Placement
token-note-hover.Tooltip.Color.title: Tooltip Color
token-note-hover.Tooltip.ForceRemove.title: Tooltip Force remove when not on hover. Note: do not use this if you need a interactive note.
token-note-hover.Tooltip.SmartPlacement.title: Tooltip activate 'Smartplacement' feature
token-note-hover.Tooltip.FollowMouse.title: Tooltip activate Follow Mouse feature
token-note-hover.Name: Name:
token-note-hover.CreateMissingFoldersC:
Create a Journal Entry folder for each player?
This ensures that each player has their own folder for entries to be created in.
token-note-hover.PlayerIconHint: Enable to override the icon players will see.
token-note-hover.PlayerIconPath:
Player Icon Path.
Note: this will override the setting 'Default Note Icon for Players' for this note.
token-note-hover.AllowPlayerNotes: Players also need the Core Foundry Permission "{permission}" to create map pins.
token-note-hover.ShowImage: Show on the tooltip linked Image instead of text ?
token-note-hover.ShowImageExplicitSource: Select and show on the tooltip a explicit Image instead linked image
token-note-hover.PreviewAsTextSnippet: Show the preview as text snippet
token-note-hover.WarningBackgroundlessPins: WARNING: The module setting 'Enable feature Backgroundless Pins' is disabled
token-note-hover.WarningPlayerIconAutoOverride: WARNING: The module setting 'Enable Player-Only Icons by default' is disabled
token-note-hover.WarningRevealedNotes: WARNING: The module setting 'Enable revealed state on scene Notes' is disabled
token-note-hover.InfoRevealedNotes:
The module setting 'Enable revealed state on scene Notes' is enabled. Remember to check these module settings:
  • Set the tint color of the Note revealed state on scene Notes
  • Linked Icon Tint
  • Not-linked Icon Tint
  • Revealed Icon Tint
  • Not-revealed Icon Tint
token-note-hover.TooltipCustomDescription: Tooltip Custom Description. This text will show up only if no journal is linked to the note
